chapter.title: Upgrading your cluster and updating software packages

abstract.para: This chapter covers two different scenarios: upgrading a cluster to another version of &productname; (either a major release or a service pack) as opposed to updating individual packages on cluster nodes. See versus .
If you want to upgrade your cluster, check and before starting to upgrade.

sect1.title: Terminology
sect1.para: In the following, find definitions of the most important terms used in this chapter:

listitem.para: A major release is a new product version that brings new features and tools, and decommissions previously deprecated components. It comes with backward incompatible changes.

If a new product version includes major changes that are backward incompatible, the cluster needs to be upgraded by a cluster offline upgrade. You need to take all nodes offline and upgrade the cluster as a whole, before you can bring all nodes back online.

In a cluster rolling upgrade one cluster node at a time is upgraded while the rest of the cluster is still running. You take the first node offline, upgrade it and bring it back online to join the cluster. Then you continue one by one until all cluster nodes are upgraded to a major version.
Combines several patches into a form that is easy to install or deploy. Service packs are numbered and usually contain security fixes, updates, upgrades or enhancements of programs.
Installation of a newer minor version of a package, which usually contains security fixes and other important fixes.
Installation of a newer major version of a package or distribution, which brings new features. See also versus .

sect1.title: Upgrading your cluster to the latest product version
sect1.para: Which upgrade path is supported, and how to perform the upgrade, depends on the current product version and on the target version you want to migrate to.

sect2.title: Supported upgrade paths for SLE HA and SLE HA Geo
sect2.para: &productname; has the same supported upgrade paths as the underlying base system. For a complete overview, see the section Supported Upgrade Paths to &sls; &productnumber; in the &sls; &upgrade_guide;.
In addition, the following rules apply, as the &ha; cluster stack offers two methods for upgrading the cluster:

formalpara.para: A cluster rolling upgrade is only supported within the same major release (from one service pack to the next, or from the GA version of a product to SP1).

A cluster offline upgrade is required to upgrade from one major release to the next (for example, from SLE HA 12 to SLE HA 15) or from a service pack within one major release to the next major release (for example, from SLE HA 12 SP5 to SLE HA 15).

important.title: No support for mixed clusters and reversion after upgrade

listitem.para: Mixed clusters running on &productname; 12/&productname; 15 are not supported.
After the upgrade process to product version 15, reverting back to product version 12 is not supported.

note.title: Skipping service packs
note.para: The easiest upgrade path is consecutively installing all service packs. For the &sle; &product-ga; product line (GA and the subsequent service packs), skipping up to two service packs is also supported when upgrading. For example, upgrading from &productnameshort; 15 SP3 to 15 SP6 is supported (as long as &productnameshort; 15 SP3 is supported).

Test the upgrade procedure on a staging instance of your cluster setup first, before performing it in a production environment. This gives you an estimation of the time frame required for the maintenance window. It also helps to detect and solve any unexpected problems.

sect2.title: Cluster rolling upgrade
sect2.para: This section describes upgrading to a new SLE HA 15 service pack. Check the supported service packs for upgrade in .
Use one of the following procedures for your scenario:

warning.title: Active cluster stack
warning.para: Before starting an upgrade for a node, stop the cluster stack on that node.
If the cluster resource manager on a node is active during the software update, this can lead to results such as fencing of active nodes.

important.title: Time limit for cluster rolling upgrade
important.para: The new features shipped with the latest product version are only available after all cluster nodes have been upgraded to the latest product version. Mixed version clusters are only supported for a short time frame during the cluster rolling upgrade. Complete the cluster rolling upgrade within one week.
Once all the online nodes are running the upgraded version, it is not possible for any other nodes with the old version to (re-)join without having been upgraded.

important.title: Time limit for rolling upgrade
important.para: The new features shipped with the latest product version are only available after all cluster nodes have been upgraded to the latest product version. Mixed version clusters are only supported for a short time frame during the rolling upgrade. Complete the rolling upgrade within one week.

warning.para: Before starting a package update for a node, either stop the cluster stack on that node or put the node into maintenance mode, depending on whether the cluster stack is affected or not. See for details.
